title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic American novel set in the Jazz Age, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A timeless story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel exploring surveillance, totalitarianism, and individualism.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: An exploration of the history of the human species from the Stone Age to the modern age.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young woman who grows up in a survivalist family and eventually earns a PhD from Cambridge.

title: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
description: A groundbreaking work that explores evolutionary biology from the gene's perspective.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: An exploration of cosmology, from the Big Bang to black holes, written for general readers.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship with practical advice on writing clean, maintainable code.

title: Design Patterns
author: Gang of Four
description: Elements of reusable object-oriented software - the definitive guide to design patterns.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andrew Hunt & David Thomas
description: Your journey to mastery - timeless tips and techniques for better programming.

title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
author: Jared Diamond
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning exploration of why some societies prospered while others did not.

title: The Code Breaker
author: Walter Isaacson
description: The story of Jennifer Doudna and the race to understand and control CRISPR gene editing.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the beloved Harry Potter series about a young wizard's magical adventures.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A timeless classic about Bilbo Baggins' unexpected journey through Middle-earth.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A Nobel Prize winner's groundbreaking work on the two systems that drive the way we think.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A gripping thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon on a quest to solve an ancient mystery.

title: Sherlock Holmes: The Complete Collection
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: The complete collection of stories featuring the world's greatest detective.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel of manners set in Georgian England, following Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A heartwarming love story that spans decades, celebrating enduring romance.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones through small changes.
